website_summaries.verdict: A good option for general road inner tubes that self-seal in the event of a small tire puncture.
pros: Contains liquid sealant inside that dries and hardens if a puncture occurs
Reduces the need for excessive patching when riding
A good precaution when riding on older or rural roads
cons: Sealant can leak when filling up the tube with air

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tubes.... "small" issue...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent seller, excellent tubes, however: I've used these tubes for many years on several bikes. I hate to this day having flats, so this is the way I go, unless it's tubeless for one bike. I will continue to buy them when needed. Hopefully each set will last years as they always do. One of the 2 tubes I ordered had a bad valve core. it would not open to install air pressure. This is the second time in 3 years this has happened. I have lots of spare parts, so replacing the core was a 2 minute thing for me anyway. the factory may need some inspection instruction....
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: best defense against thorns
customer_reviews.text: no more sheeps head (goat head) thorns, yes! A flat on the front, bought this inner tube ... now a flat on the back, bought another ... damn thornes. I think this inner tube will outlast the bike!
customer_reviews.author: OC-Adam

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointing. Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: The thorn resistance and slime seemed like such good things. Stronger tubes, right? More reliable? No. The inner tubes are excessively rigid, which makes them difficult to get on the wheel in the first place. The rigidity means that, as you bicycle along, the tubes tend to creep along inside the wheel. My first tube came apart at the valve due to stress from being marched along the wheel. My second one had apparently managed to goo up its own valve and couldn't be inflated at all. Thumbs down. Both thumbs. Possibly, both big toes, too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Hanlin

customer_reviews.title: Split at the seam
customer_reviews.text: Put the tube in my bike about 2 month ago, and due to work and the weather I just started riding again. Two days of off and on riding, the tire suddenly went flat while I was riding. Removal of the tube showed a 2" split at the seam. I inspected the rim, saw nothing that would split it. Went with another brand and all is well. Really disappointed, I've used these tubes in other bikes with great success, not sure if I just happened to get a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: corvette

customer_reviews.title: Don't last
customer_reviews.text: Didnt last on my 11 year olds daughter more than 2 months. Never offroad, always street or sidewalk as she uses it for school. I replaced 2 with leaking valve stems. The ones I replaced did the same thing. The tubes where installed correctly as I've replaced tubes what, my entire life. The valves where straight out of the rim. There was no sign of puncture anywhere and if I fill the tube up and tough the valve it leaks. Underwater in a pool shows no other leaks in the tube. Green slime all in the valve as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Jenn

customer_reviews.title: i had no idea they would add 20 lbs to my bike ...!!
customer_reviews.text: okay not 20 lbs but it kinda feels like it ...! buyer beware! next thing ... lose another star for the fact that it doesn't quite fill up my 2" tire - there's lots of squidgy wrinkled tire around the tube when you apply pressure ... did they want to save on material thinking it would turn into profit? i guess i can see why the valves get damaged. Also note: i had the 'other' 'petite' kind of valve on previously (thank god i got rid of those - impossible to find a filling station that has those) but I ended up needing to REDRILL my wheel to get the schraeder stem through
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: If You're In Rough Terrain, These Are the Ticket!
customer_reviews.text: I have very rugged mountain trails I ride -- lots of gravel, sharp rocks and cactus with long thorns. I've had many a flat, both on my bike, and on various equipment I run here. So when I was changing my mountain bike tires (for wide Kendra aggressive tread tires, also available on Amazon), I wanted something other than standard tubes. (I put slime in my old tubes, but they were only standard thickness). These thorn resistant "5 times thicker" Slime tubes did the trick! Sure they cost a few dollars, but the peace of mind on a long mountain ride, and the way they've already protected me in some iffy situations, is well worth it. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Family

customer_reviews.title: FInally
customer_reviews.text: I had changed the tube on one of the bikes at our beach house at least 5 times. Finally I used electrical tape to cover anything inside the metal rim putting holes in tubes and bought this beast tube. This tube is thick and should last. After 4 days it was still holding air when I left so calling it good.
customer_reviews.author: Hawgfan

customer_reviews.title: The valve of this tube is shorted than HALF the length of the dust cap that comes with it
customer_reviews.text: Stem is too short for DOUBLE WALL wheel, compare two pictures. My older front wheel inner tube has a valve that is MORE THAN TWICE the length of the dust cap that comes with it. The new inner tube for my rear tire has a valve that is LESS than HALF the length of the dust cap that comes with it
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my bike pump.
customer_reviews.text: Used for a month without any problems until I tried to check the tire pressure with my brand new bike pump. Turns out the valve stem had failed; filling my pump with "super thick smart sealing slime". Now I'm down a tire & a $35 bike pump. Better off packing an extra tube than relying on this gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: These inner tubes are the ticket to no flats.
customer_reviews.text: I deliver food in my town in Kansas we have goat head stickers and nails all over. I bought this inner tube which is VERY thick. It is also heavy so if you looking to shed weight this is not for you. These inner tubes are the ticket, for small nails, and those pesky goat heads.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Inflates about half way and then the valve sticks like you’re trying to blow air into a bowl of concrete. I was going to return it but it appears that I have to pay the shipping to send it back so I decided not to. Extremely disappointed. Also took forever to get shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley A. Eakins

customer_reviews.title: Random
customer_reviews.text: No idea what to say here that would benefit someone else when making a choice of which inner tube to buy. I have two of these. One of them has worked great for about a month now. The second one failed after about a week. The tubing was fine but I found the tire flat one morning. When I tried to unscrew the dust cap, the whole valve stem came out. I was not pulling hard on it. I gave it a two star rating because, yes it might work, but why should you be paying $15 dollars for something that might work? Noticed some other reviewers saying the same thing
customer_reviews.author: mr dead

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Very seriously heavy duty innertube! I was able to put it on my rim with zero effort. I didn't have any of the slime leaking out of the valve stem issues others have, I think maybe because they werent rotating the tire so the slime runs out of it? no idea. In any case, great tube, zero issues, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lapinski

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I live is a desert environment that has a lot of thorns and stickers.. these work as well as can be expected. The places where my kids ride has caused them to deflate, but the good thing about these tubes is that refill with air and ride again, instead of patching their tire tubes..
customer_reviews.author: natalie hardin

customer_reviews.title: Holds Pressure But 1 Year + Aged Tube Sprang a Leak On Its Own
customer_reviews.text: Tubes definitely hold tire pressure longer than without 'slime', but my tube recently sprang a leak probably due to high pressure, 100 deg+ temperature, age (1year +), and the 'slime' did nothing except leak out of the tube.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. from Orange County, CA

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: These seem very thick and sturdy. Unfortunately thae means they literally add pounds to your ride. I recommend only putting it in your rear wheel which is a more difficult tire change and use a standard tube on the front
customer_reviews.author: Vuil Hond

customer_reviews.title: Super tough but heavy and slime can damage your pump
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these thinking never flat would be great. The problem is that you are unable to lower the pressure if you over inflate or install out of alignment because the slime will destroy whatever pump you are using. While the tube is super thick and seems like it can take a beating, it is also very heavy and difficult to install. I don't see myself ever buying one of these again. I plan to cut these with a knife and switch back to a non-slime version in the spring to avoid any further losses.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spliedt

customer_reviews.title: These are made of unicorn antlers
customer_reviews.text: My local bike shop calls me "The Red Monster" because I have destroyed tires, wheels, and indeed entire frames. I once managed to wreck 2 tubes simultaneously on beach sand. That being said, I have met my match. It's been several months now, and I have yet to wreck these things. Are they made of Kevlar? Diamonds? Unicorn antler? I don't know, but they sure are durable. Just as easy to install as regular tubes, despite the thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C

customer_reviews.title: Product may not live up to expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Within 3 months I got a flat out of nowhere, after examining the tube I noticed it was punctured on the area where it makes contact to the wheel line. I also noticed that the tube at that location has riblike indentations going with the tube longwise and it was uneven thickness. I was disappointed very likely I got a defective piece. Would like to think manufacturer have high QA standadars.
customer_reviews.author: Arr

customer_reviews.title: Good Tube, best one we've gotten from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this inner tube. All of the other inner tubes that we've gotten on Amazon have not lasted a week. If you want a sturdy, long lasting inner tube, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy H.

customer_reviews.title: Great tube.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, good quality and hopefully no punctures in the future. Hand pump fill to pressure noted on tire. Adjust position as the tire fills so stem is straight on the rim. Would definitely use again and got 4 for 2 bikes. Nice peace of mind at a good price. A little heavier then thin tube but not noticible unless you are racing.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Leaky schrader core
customer_reviews.text: Leaky schrader core. Tried tightening but it didn't work. Had to take the one out of my old tube and insert it into the new tube to get it to seal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for the lightweight obsessed
customer_reviews.text: Yep, Super Thick means Super Heavy. I am pretty sure that these innertubes are heavier than my aluminum wheels on my mountain bike, but this doesn't bother me since I need the extra weight for training. I ordered these after experiencing six flats in two months, apparently someone driving in the vicinity I ride has bald tires with an exposed steel belt. So hopefully Slime Super Thick Self-Sealing tubes are the answer for what I need until I can purchase some kevlar lined tires.
customer_reviews.author: Major HavocTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Size not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: 26 inch was more like 28 inch. Too big for tire but made it work. Wouldn't go kn any long rides but okay for around the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: No more flats.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Thorns pulled out, slime immediately stopped the leak. Adds some weight to overall bike weight as they are heavier than regular tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement inner tube
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement tube, I installed it in like 5 minutes. Love knowing that my daughter’s bike has a quality tube that will self-repair any small punctures. Pure quality all the way.
customer_reviews.author: C-C

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t Fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 26 x 1.75-3.125 tube. It pushed 2 26x2.125 tires past the rim. Couldn’t get the tires’ beads to stay seated inside the wheels rims when only partially inflated.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Coulter

customer_reviews.title: Great Tube but Sealant has Setbacks
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be a super durable and thick rubber. The hole sealing gel seems to be just an added bonus at this point. However, I live in the Northwest where it rains and his wet a lot and the cycle shops don't recommend these as the sealant is water-soluble and won't plug the hole for very long. So if you live in an arid, dry climate it would probably work the best.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeFan

customer_reviews.title: Crappy product
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for my sons bike. Installed them both at the same time. The front tube deflated within a few hours. When aired up it held air a couple times for a few minutes. Then it stopped holding air at all. When my husband took it apart to look it was broken around the valve stem. The second tube lasted until right after the return time for amazon and then did the exact same thing as the first tube. Only didn’t hold air at all again after it deflated the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my beach cruiser. Weight is not an issue with me. A flat is not an option for me!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Arizona approved
customer_reviews.text: With all the little stickers that one could pickup while riding in the Arizona desert this tube makes all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Slime clogs the valve
customer_reviews.text: The valve immediately clogged with green slime after installing and I tried to let some air out. Wasted 1 hour installing, removing it, the packaging it for return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty tube but extremely thin and hard rubber at the base of valve stem. First ride out the valve stem tore at the base. Stem was straight, pressure was good but tore riding down the trail. If they can fix the stem base they’ll have a solid design, but until then going back to liners and the regular slime tubes.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Ordered 6 size 26. 1 sent was size 20. 4 of the remaining 5 have given out at the base of the valve stems within one hour of riding. The last is still in the box. What's your bet? Pieces of junk. A total rip off and way to ruin your riding plans.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Holme

customer_reviews.title: Bad Stem Valve
customer_reviews.text: The stem valve was stuck on this new inner tube when I installed it, preventing any inflation. I tried removing, cleaning, and reinstalling it, suspecting the chemical sealant slime within the tube had solidified and locked it. There was no evidence of such sealant clogging and nothing worked to allow inflation. Consequently, I was forced to replace the stem valve entirely. I additionally had to invest in a valve stem puller tool because the plastic dust cap reverse end was not rugged enough to loosen the valve, as it bent and became useless.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Young

customer_reviews.title: Failed for unknown reason
customer_reviews.text: Developed a crack like puncture on the "upper" (towards the rim) side of the tube, slime did not seal the leak despite much time & effort spent to ensure that slime got to the leak site. Leak was not due to a pinch or spoke or rim tape failure, reason for failure unidentifiable but apparently a defect of the tube. Due to distance from home tried automotive fix-a-flat which sealed the leak for less than a mile, wound up riding a Taxi home with a stinky slime/fix-a-flat covered rim & tire.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Smith

customer_reviews.title: Little expensive, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the peace of mind that it may help from getting a flat. Heavy duty tube.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Warren

customer_reviews.title: No need for constant pumping up
customer_reviews.text: I will only use double thick tubes. They hold air pressure much longer than the thin tubes and they resist thorns and other damage
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Baker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Valve stem cracked after 3 miles travel. Will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: paul d. schelble

customer_reviews.title: The Slime and a Kevlar Liner - A Great Choice for Goat Head Territory
customer_reviews.text: I live on a ranch in a rural area and use my mountain bike to get around the property. We have an abundance of goat heads and my inner tube was showing its age. I replaced with the Slime and a Kevlar liner. I'm not concerned with the weight - I just don't want a flat. This was a good choice and a recommended solution.
customer_reviews.author: El Paso Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to... sort of
customer_reviews.text: I can't in good conscience give this a full 5-stars because over time my tires still go flat. These do seal... er... SLOW the leak, but not fully SEAL the leak. I think these would work best with some sort of thorn-resistant tires because the standard tires I have on my mountain bike are constantly getting punctures.
customer_reviews.author: DickMcK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, But Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Okay, totally worth it...but they add a bunch of weight on your ride. Be aware of that, yet you feel very confident and comfortable riding them. I would say if you have a very light weight bike with these, you're good.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D.

customer_reviews.title: Split / hole developed at base of stem
customer_reviews.text: The slime works well at plugging leaks in the tube itself, however a split / hole developed at the base of the stem that was not reparable.
customer_reviews.author: AZMark

customer_reviews.title: Great product, heavy duty, great price!
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, slightly heavier than expected, but that's why they are extra thorn resistant...highly recommend them to anyone looking for some extra protection that can handle pushing around some extra heavy tires...26"er's are easy to install without tools or assistance too, just make sure you line your gears up correctly before you go yankin your bike apart, youtube tutorials are your friend ;)
customer_reviews.author: Theo from Maine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tube to stop the flats
customer_reviews.text: I have a very long driveway with lots of jagged stones. I suppose that is why I kept getting flats. I kept checking to see if anything was stuck in the tire or poking the tube but found nothing. I bought a can of slime-like goo (not this brand) but it did not help and caused a mess. I found this thicker tube with slime already in it and a year later the tube is still holding air. Update: after another year it is still holding air just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kam14

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.  Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Heavy duty tube. Perfect for my lawn cart that I always overload. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I maintain a small fleet of bikes in the desert and these are the only tubes I buy. The are expensive and heavy, but I have never had to patch a hole in one. Regular tubes filled with slime sealant stol need regular patching due to the many kinds of thorns around here. These extra thick tubes may lose a little air now and again but I just pump them back up and they self seal. If you care more about durability than weight, buy these tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Hi Desert

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This tube works like a regular tube back in the 50's. I holds air and doesn't need to be reinflated for an acceptable period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy, breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This tire tube isn’t that sturdy. It broke with no warning after only using it for just a month for me. This is with constant maintenance to the bike every week, checking for tire pressure and tire damages. It just suddenly broke on me during a weekend biking workout. Not the greatest tube, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These tubes are the best thick strong well made durable hold up to thorns and stickers and prevents flats
customer_reviews.author: BN

customer_reviews.title: and I was not disappointed so I bought a pair for my bike
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this brand, I got a new bike and we have goat heads all over living in the desert! I got a pair for my son's bike trailer before I bought for my bike, and I was not disappointed so I bought a pair for my bike, I'm pleased and no flats! Not even loss of air! I love these and will continue to buy if I get new bikes, etc. :D
customer_reviews.author: Zodiac

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.  Thanks!
customer_reviews.text: I do like it....if for no other reason than the $&$#@# thing holds air! How refreshing to not have to air my tires up once a week. I should send you folks a Christmas card just for that, alone. That said, it is really heavy. If I was a racer, I'd probably not be too keen on that, but for my purposes, it great.
customer_reviews.author: Hematite

customer_reviews.title: THICK THICK THICK!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a think, 'SUPER THICK' bicycle tube, look no further. If weight is a serious issue, these may not be suitable for you.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Passed the nail test
customer_reviews.text: Got a nail in this, pulled it out and it hasn't lost pressure for about a month now. Had tried putting Stan's No Tubes in a flat tube. It didn't hold air very long but it completely sealed the valve so I couldn't put more air in. I thought these Slime tubes had a separate chamber for the sealant but I just reviewed the ad and this is not what it shows. Perhaps I will try again with the Stan's NT starting with a new tube.
customer_reviews.author: GHWellsJr.

customer_reviews.title: Slime tube
customer_reviews.text: Thicker then I thought and you can feel the slime coating inside. Looks to be great quality and has held up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Master Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Waaaaaay heavier than I expected. About 6 times as heavy as a normal tube. I suppose if your a beast and you really want to avoid punctures then these are for you, but if you are weight conscious and don't want an extra 5 lbs on your bike (for the pair) than find another solution.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany G.

customer_reviews.title: Proceed with care they are Over rated !
customer_reviews.text: The tubes appeared to be of good durability. I installed the 1st one it lasted 5 days. The tube ruptured and I installed the 2nd tube it ruptured on the 3rd day. Both tubes had problems next to the valve stems.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Riley

customer_reviews.title: Not good long term
customer_reviews.text: These are good when first installed. After a while they are hard to inflate if the valve leaks a little. I would not recommend these unless you plan to use them for a short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: BobM

customer_reviews.title: With these your good to go and your all set to enjoy bike rides instead of flat tires!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the flat resistant aspect of the tubes!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie lopez

customer_reviews.title: No more flats
customer_reviews.text: Great flat stopper as I ride the bike lane daily
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W Thompson IV

customer_reviews.title: 50% reliable???
customer_reviews.text: We bought two pair of these tubes and two out of the four the rubber failed at the bottom of the valve and split, leaking 'slime' all over the place and resulted and a long walk home pushing the bike. Would I buy them again? No Way! Nor can I recommend them to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Old "experienced" guy

customer_reviews.title: Great With Caviat
customer_reviews.text: If you want a thick, durable tube, this is the one. If you need a tube that's actually going to fit in a saddle bag, etc., this could be a problem. It's so thick that I can't get it to fit in my small saddle bag made for standard bike tubes. I guess it's a trade off you have to live with. Hey, SLiME. You make a nice thorn resistant tube. Any chance you can make your thick thinner? Just poking fun.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: It fit my trike
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a flat yet. Don't ride much but it is a heavy thick tube.
customer_reviews.author: Chad & Nell

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: 43 goat heads in one tire and no leaks or even pressure lost. With my old tube I would have a flat or major pressure loss even with slime in the tube. The slime would seal the leaks but each puncture still looses a small amount of air. They are about twice as heavy as a regular tube so if weight is problem you may not like these. If you have constant small punctures you will love these inner tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your TIME on the SLIME
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time on this slime nonsense. I got flats just as easily, and the slime made no difference, just made changing the tube messier. Get a stronger tire (eg with a kevlar strip) instead. That's worked much better for me on preventing flats.
customer_reviews.author: Domingo Galdos

customer_reviews.title: they work great..
customer_reviews.text: They are very difficult to get onto your rim. VERY difficult. Once there, they work great...though slime coming back through the Schrader Valve is a very real issue. Over time, they hold air great...perhaps because I have a slime filled Schrader Valve. :~/
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I white thru three tires because I'm a bit heavy at 250 but when I installed this one is worried great. Already went 60 miles on it
customer_reviews.author: Mariaamazon

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for hot climates
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended for hot climates. New tube regularly lost 8 to 10 psi of air pressure overnight. Lasted ~400 miles before complete failure with sealant oozing out.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Great durable tubes. Their bulk can make installation a little tricky but well worth the effort
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use but don't reuse.
customer_reviews.text: I like walking and I like riding a bike. I don't like walking a bike. I haven't tried this particular product yet so I'll report later, but I have used slime and sometimes it can be messy but it always works. Just don't put in too much air after a flat. If designed to get you home.
customer_reviews.author: waltackerman

customer_reviews.title: Great tubes!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace four year old tubes.I use Slime liquid in my tires as there are a lot of thorns, pickers, etc. in Arizona. These tubes come with Slime already in them and are extra thick to prevent flats. They installed easily, just remember to lightly inflate them, it does help. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: LAKESIDE DOUG

customer_reviews.title: A Year of No Flats So Far
customer_reviews.text: I bike to work every day. After going through a few regular tubes, getting flats from thorns or who knows what else, I decided to try out these Smart Tubes. I got one for both the back and front tire of my bike about a year ago, and I haven't had a flat since. Your mileage may vary of course, but these tubes have been an excellent deal for me so far. I'd recommend them. Worth the extra money if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Beach

customer_reviews.title: Bought two of these 8 months ago. One was ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these 8 months ago. One was dead on arrival. As soon as it was pumped up, it leaked at the seam. No biggie, it happens. Replaced it via Amazon, fairly painless. Rode on both tubes a bit before the winter and sat there for a few months when it was cold. When I finally got the bike out, I was pleasantly surprised to see no leak at all after a couple of seasons. 4 miles into the ride, it went flat. Guess what? It leaked at the seam (upper side facing the rim) again. That's two out of two.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Wong

customer_reviews.title: Clogs the valve stem
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately these did not work for me. The green slim completely clogged the valve stem which prevented me from checking the air pressure or putting more air in the tire, which needs to be done periodically even when you don't have any leaks. It also prevents you from deflating the tube and changing tires should you decide to do so.
customer_reviews.author: One Day at a Time

customer_reviews.title: works as designed
customer_reviews.text: installed with no issues, hopefully will protect against flats on a beach cruiser bike
customer_reviews.author: BeachLover

customer_reviews.title: Patching regime is history.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like every bike ride I would have flat that needed patching. Sometimes the holes were so tiny I could hardly find them by submersing the tube in a bucket of water. I don'y know if I had faulty inner tubes or what? I looked on Amazon and went with the average customer review. I have not had a flat yet. Outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: SmokingChicken

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Thorn Resistant
customer_reviews.text: I changed my back tube to this tube last year because I could not patch it any more. I have never had flat tire on the back tire since then; while I had to patch my front tube two times. I am going to buy another one for my front tire. WARNING:: If you relieve the air from the tube, beware that the green slime may leak out with the air. You have to rotate the tube so that the valve is up high.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tiamsuphat

customer_reviews.title: No flats yet
customer_reviews.text: After getting two flats from goatheads in the same three mile bike ride, I bought these thorn resistant tires and paired them with Mr. Tuffy liners. I've ridden that same stretch a few more times as well as to work and back (50ish miles so far) and haven't had a flat yet.
customer_reviews.author: jmerc

customer_reviews.title: Have not Flattened Once
customer_reviews.text: I Ride For Miles, over streets, gravel, dirt trails,desert,and from time to time Snow and Ice the tubes Work Anywhere.The weight is not and issue it will help in the snow and it feels like I'm going faster down hill. anyways Great Product. Please Note their are Two Kinds of Valves the Schrader (common) and the Pariva or something to that affect So Have Fun.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Antony

customer_reviews.title: Kind of heavy, but they hardly ever need replacing
customer_reviews.text: I used these in my mountain bike on a lot of thorny streets and roads along with the tire liners. I've gone over staples, glass, thorns and lots more, these almost never pop. Worth the investment and time you save my not having to replace your tubes! The only downside is that they add a decent amount of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Slime 26" SV Thorn Resistant Thick Smart tube 26 x 1.75-2.125 (Schrader Valve)
customer_reviews.text: I am sure this tube will be durable because it it at least three times as thick and heavy as a standard tube.On the other hand this because of the added weight may not be in your best interest.I also had trouble filling one of the two I purchased.I had to remove the schrader valve and clean the coagulated slime from the valve in order to fill the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Sure you could buy some cheap tubes to save $ then mabey get a flat only to be stranded or Pay the extra money to get the best
customer_reviews.text: We never buy any tubes unless they are heavy duty slime tubes.We have used them for many years they work great.!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Double protection
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other thorn resistant tubes before but these are my first order from Slime. I really like the fact that these are not only super thick tubes, but have the added air loss protection on the slime itself. Reasonable price, no hassle transaction.
customer_reviews.author: SLK

customer_reviews.title: Works well after initial inflate pain
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have no problems once inflated and installed, but inflating is a pain. The goo slightly clogs up the valve stem or something. I inflate, check with my finger and ear for releasing pressure, and deflate some to try to clear the stem, then repeat. The 3 I got eventually inflated fine and posed no further problems.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Otto

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but durable
customer_reviews.text: If weight is not a concern, then this is the tube for you. Still no punctures that I'm aware of, and that's sort of the point. These tubes hold the air you put in them. I have the Slime on the front and a regular tube on the back. Even after a few months, the Slime tire remains filled with no added air. Can't say the same for the rear.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy D

customer_reviews.title: It's as easy as any standard tube to install
customer_reviews.text: Talk about thick!!! This inner tube is a beast. It's as easy as any standard tube to install. Costs a little more but if it helps to prevent another flat, I think it's worth it. I'm slowly installing these tubes in all my bikes and keeping the standard tubes as backups.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: The best tube for Mountain Biking.
customer_reviews.text: The tube is thorn resistant. I never get flats mountain biking around town on and off road. Yes a bit heavier then normal tubes but adds to the work out plus overall safety because the side walls are stronger giving stiffer turns at higher speeds. More importantly this product is never carried in local bike ships so this is a great alternative using Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dylon Frazah

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Not only have I not had a flat in 6 months since using this, I barely have to re-fill the air. Keeps air pressure over longer periods than my previous cheapo ones. The only thing worth noting, is because of how thick they are, it can be a little tight getting the tire back on.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh M

customer_reviews.title: Slime tubes are usually ok.
customer_reviews.text: It's good. The Slime sealant has always been hit and miss for me, but the tube itself is nice and thick. I just needed them for the family commuters so I wasn't too concerned about weight or anything.
customer_reviews.author: BS AZ

customer_reviews.title: five star
customer_reviews.text: They are 5 star all the way. Best tube ever. One draw back to these tubes. I bought Kevlar tires AFTER these slimes were already installed. When I released the air, the slime came out and clogged the valve. I had to remove the valves to finish letting the air out.And I had to clean the valves.
customer_reviews.author: peter guerriera

customer_reviews.title: OMG, why did I wait so long to get these!!
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around for a light weight thorn resistant tube and this was the best quality and price! I've had these on for several months now and they are great. I was worried that they'd be heavy and/or less shock absorbent but it's not as bad as I worried it would be, but it was slightly. No regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Gigi Sings

customer_reviews.title: New and improved on anything is a good thing
customer_reviews.text: I have had the skinnier if you will of these tubes and they don't hold up as well as these do to sudden impact & puncture within reason. Until something better comes along for this size tube its the best you are gonna get for now and it's nice to know it has slime in it as a added backup if ya will ;).
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: I had it break right at the stem - but ...
customer_reviews.text: I had it break right at the stem - but to be fair - I had this happen with another brand too
customer_reviews.author: eric Krieg

customer_reviews.title: Slime 26" thorn resistant tube
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a semi timely fashion. When installed functioned briefly until the valve stem came off in my hand merely hours after installing. For a bit of relevance: I've been an avid cyclist / with no auto / for over 20 years. Amazon was awesome when they refunded me almost instantly w/o requiring me to send the faulty tube back.
customer_reviews.author: Laukie

customer_reviews.title: Only way to go!
customer_reviews.text: Great tube! This tube is the only way to go. Do not waste your time or money on the walmart tubes....they are thin and will need to be replaced in no time. I purchased this a few months back and we my son is always riding his bike through anything and everything. The tubes are still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: jeremy brunner

customer_reviews.title: No leaks so far
customer_reviews.text: Installed these with new tires several months ago. I have not had to air them up again yet. They are heavy, but that is expected. My bike is by far from a minimalist design anyway. It took a little work to get them straightened out when installing on the rim - nothing bad enough to drop another star rating though.
customer_reviews.author: J. MILES

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and a great solution if you are tired of goat-head related flats
customer_reviews.text: Good solution for goat-head(Puncture Vine) prone areas. I have been using these for a couple of years and have never had a flat. Compared with regular mountain bike slime tires, which flatted often, these are the best solution for the Colorado single tracks that I ride. They do add extra weight to your bike and they are too large to carry as a spare in your Camelbak. They are too heavy for use in competitive racing scenarios, however, they will not leave you stranded in a remote area.
customer_reviews.author: BarryMB

customer_reviews.title: Just like flatblocker max
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Bought these for my new mtb. With the regular tubes the bike came with, I got leaks in each of the tubes in less than a week from thorns that look like goathead thorns. With these tubes, after the couple of weeks I've had them, no leaks so far. I pumped them up to 40psi. I think this is the same tube as the bell 'flatblocker max' that I used on my old bike (), but which I couldn't find in 26" size anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Floridian

customer_reviews.title: Same Product, Better Protection
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace an inter tube my wife blow on her bike. The rubber is moderately thicker than the previous slime tubes and fells as if it can take a little more of a beating. The tube fitted into the tire with no problems and aired up with no problems. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Codi L Brooks

product_meta.title: Super Thick Smart Tubes
feature_bullets: Extra thick tube pre-installed with Slime Sealant to provide maximum puncture protection and prevent flat tires
Instantly and repeatedly seals tire punctures for up to 2 years
Designed to seal tread area punctures

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
